intro: Bursa tuscaloosae, commonly known as the Tuscaloosa burr, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-centered flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruit is a spiny capsule that aids in seed dispersal by attaching to the fur of animals. Bursa tuscaloosae is often found in open woodlands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
